result.execSummary:
The defendant Vontrell D. Cooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vontrell D. Cooks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vontrell D. Cooks was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vontrell D. Cooks

records.addlTxt:
2:53 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vontrell D. Cooks in court.  Attorney David Patton in court for Vontrell D. Cooks. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:22CM374/22CM1297. Matters are resolved and agreement placed on the record. DE advises the Court that his correct date of birth is 3/8/1988; DE provides his Wisconsin drivers license as proof. Court notes that DE's correct DOB is 3/8/1988.

22CM374: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders a $500 fine plus costs and DNA surcharge; bond applied and any remainder due within 90 days or civil judgment.  

22CM1297: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 2-3 are dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders a $100 fine plus costs and DNA surcharge; 90 days to pay or 10 days KCJ or work crew.  

Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample, notice given to def. in court in Case 22CM374. Appeals rights given.
Plea/sentencing rescheduled on the Court's motion, Court unavailable on 8/19/22. Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled to September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Parties notified by email.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
At the direction of the Court PTC set for 7/5/22 has been removed from the calendar. Parties notified by email and PLEAS has been scheduled for 8/19/22 at 11 am.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Patton.   Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Patton states he recently got this case and needs to talk with ADA Binger about an offer. PTC set to 07/05/22 at 1:30.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *No Weapons especially firearms.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Aaliyah B.

03:48 PM  
  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $1000 Continued Posted  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).   jk
